attributes.action: Call upon the government to provide a healthy food subsidy
attributes.background: Make the government responsible for health food subsidy to help combat obesity

attributes.action: Bring more awareness and raise more money towards Dementia Researching
attributes.background: I believe that not enough people are aware of how badly Dementia is becoming. 1 in 3 people over 65 will die with dementia. 850, 000 were diagnosed with dementia in 2015. Researchers are still unaware of the proper causes and require more money to extend research and medical help, so help raise it.
attributes.additional_details: Visit: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/statistics and https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/site/scripts/documents_info.php?documentID=535&pageNumber=2 for more information.

attributes.action: Stop calling the rise in minimum wage the living wage as it clearly isn't.
attributes.background: The Tory party and now all the media have fallen in to a trap of calling the 50P rise in the minimum wage as the living wage. It is not the living wage and calling it such devalues the living wage.

attributes.action: Abolish The Houses of Parliament/Lords in favour of local Regional Assemblies.
attributes.background:
Staying in the European Community inevitably means more legislation being passed by the European Parliament that will supersede our sovereign legislation leaving our legislature as merely  nodding donkeys.
The money saved by closure of both houses is colossal with the saved money put to better use.

attributes.action: Stop Landlords from discriminating against individuals who claim housing benefit
attributes.background: As housing prices are rising, people are finding it harder to put put a roof over their heads. Many families facing financial difficulties are being turned away from renting simply because they claim housing benefit. As long as the landlord gets their money what is the problem?

attributes.action: Add a BH on the 1st/2nd Mon of Nov as a perpetual reminder celebrating WW1 & WW2
attributes.background: In 2018, it will be the 100th Anniversary of the end of WW1. We currently commemorate both WW1 & WW2 by having some form of ceremony on the 11th November each year. Let's change that from a ceremony into a Bank Holiday on the 1st or 2nd Monday of November as a perpetual reminder.

attributes.action: Help for separated parents to get back on the property ladder
attributes.background: Especially when the 'other half' is legally entitled to the existing property (if children are involved) and the person who has to leave, finds it difficult to start again and fund a new purchase (especially when older, 40+) with deposit, stamp duty and a limited mortgage term due to age.

attributes.action: Food tolerance testing on the NHS
attributes.background: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week.
attributes.additional_details: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week. This is costing the NHS millions every year treating people with drugs and tests when it can all be done with a simple food tolerance test that the NHS do not supply.  sign this petition to get this service put on the NHS to help 1000 of people each year lead a pain free life.

attributes.action: Intervene in Crimea and return it to the Ukraine Government
attributes.background:
Russia has annexed Crimea and have claimed it since 2014. Two years later and no action has been taken. 

2,423 killed, 6,820 wounded, 378 missing and 2,768 people captured as a result of Russian Military Intervention. 

Economic sanctions are not enough. Action is needed.

attributes.action: Call for legal representation for all children detained by the police at school
attributes.background: Currently innocent children unaware of their legal rights can be secretly detained and questioned by the police and social workers at their school without parents. Any questioning by the police should be done at a police station in the presence of a legal representative for the child, not at school.
attributes.additional_details: Call for the government to debate that schools should be a place of learning not for children to be detained and questioned. The relationship between children, parents and the school should only relate to education and schools should be a place of opportunity for children to develop their personality and talents and prepare for responsibility in life. Schools should be neutral and not police detention centres.  The Rights of children must be protected at school and not to have their rights abused

attributes.action: Abolish the use of whole life sentences in England and Wales
attributes.background: Whole life sentences mean that a prisoner is effectively condemned to stay in prison until they die. There are about 8,000 prisoners serving life sentences in England and Wales, and at least 60 of those are serving whole life sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Nobody can predict when a prisoner will die, and in many cases they will reach an age where they will be no threat to society. And it has been proven in the past that even some of the worst criminals can rehabilitate and therefore qualify for parole. And what incentive do they have to behave in prison if they have no realistic hope of parole? Several such prisoners have behaved very violently in prison,  injuring other inmates, and one even committed further killings in prison.

attributes.action: National Volunteer Service. (NVS)
attributes.background: In the old days we had a national service where two years were spent training and preparing for war as apart of our public service, instead of destroying the world with our hands, we can build and heal the world by volunteering at home or abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea is to get youth involved in aid, charity, sustainable development and homelessness programmes. A mandatory year is spent in volunteering after compulsory education. This would be an excellent opportunity for youth to gain work experience, a work ethic, employment opportunities, to character build and have fun.

This was inspired through the work undertaken by being a volunteer in the Raleigh ICS programme.

attributes.action: Make arrangements due to the EU Referendum clashing with Glastonbury festival.
attributes.background:
The date for the EU Referendum is on the 23rd June. This date falls within Glastonbury Festival.

Holding the vote on the same day as around 150,000 will be otherwise occupied is a disgrace to democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that either special arrangements are made so the attendees can vote or the vote is moved.

Making sure people are aware of the upcoming vote and ensuring the postal voting system can cope with the influx of votes would be a prudent move.

Additionally, work with the organisers of the festival to communicate with attendees the importance of the vote and communicate how to register to vote via post.

attributes.action: Allow Councils to decide the amount of Hunting they want to allow.
attributes.background: The Hunting Act of 2004 and the Protection of Wild Mammals Act (Scotland) of 2002, ban the Hunting of wild mammals with dogs. There are arguments for and against this bill, but there is a large amount of people who want it repealed and a large amount of people who want it strengthened.
attributes.additional_details: Why not allow local councils to vote whether to keep the ban as it, weaken it slightly, strengthen it, or outright repeal it, this would be a way for local democracy in this country to help those who feel passionately on both sides. This could allow councils in rural areas that are against the ban, to show this and would allow councils in areas where people are passionately for the ban to strengthen the ban to levels they find acceptable?

attributes.action: Urgently Review current legislation on Oil&Gas developments near major Airports.
attributes.background:
With the news out recently regarding Horse Hill and the flow testing of their well of which has produced flows of conventional oil, it's apparent that the legislation needs to be reviewed urgently.
This well is just over a mile from Gatwick airport and clearly this is a concern if it was developed.
attributes.additional_details: Listed companies that are investors in HorseHill developments Ltd the licence holder of the well, have recently realised RNS's confirming flow rates of Oil and clearly this projects is likely to be developed over time and the current laws and regs do not reflect this advancement and their are concerns regarding safety considering this well and any future (possibly hundreds) wells are within a very short distance from a major airport (gatwick) oil storage tanks and airplanes don't mix.

attributes.action: Ban publicly accountable bodies from buying through 'middlemen' companies.
attributes.background: public sector buying organisations should not be able to outsource to larger private companies/buying platforms when dealing with small business. This only enriches the middlemen, prevents barriers to small business and will not produce public savings or improve quality of services.
attributes.additional_details: The North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) representing twelve local authorities and others such as Sanctuary Housing group has appointed a single private company called NEPRO which small business must trade through. This outsources responsibility to a private company, prices will rise to pay the middlemen, public money will not be saved. It is another barrier to small business trading with government. It is also bad practice as the middlemen can control trade and who gets opportunities.

attributes.action: Rethink the way in which employment and support allowance is examined
attributes.background: Employment support allowance medical assessments are only done once at 14 weeks - things can change medically so they need doing more than once - they are also not robust enough
attributes.additional_details: I have several disabilities and illnesses myself and have been placed in the work category yet I am unable to hold down a job

attributes.action: Create a law that babies born prison should live with other relatives
attributes.background: Babies who are born in prison can't help it and should be moved to other relatives or adopted.
attributes.additional_details: Actually what inspired me may sound really cheesy, but it was Aerosmith's cover of Give Peace A Chance, with Sierra Leone's all-star refugees saying we shouldn't punish the kids for what they never did. Just like whether someone is black, or white, or Asian or whatever, they can't help it. And neither are kids who are born in prisons. Adults who go to prison KNOW why they're there and it's because they've done wrong (90% of the time), so I'm calling on David Cameron to create a law which means babies born in UK prisons are immediately taken out to live with other relatives in a stable loving home, or if needs be, adopted/fostered.

attributes.action: Limit council tax exemption to students housed in purpose built accommodation.
attributes.background: When Coventry planning committee agree another student accommodation development they quote that this will return a good number of current "student houses" back to use as family homes. To encourage this only students in purpose built multiple occupation properties should be exempt from council tax.

attributes.action: Make competition in the water industry as we currently have for gas and electric
attributes.background: Competition in the gas and electricity market has been in force for over 15 years however the water industry remains an uncompetitive market whereby a consumer has no choice over who supplies their clean water and who deals with waste water.
attributes.additional_details: Gas and electricity is an open market allowing a consumer to switch supplier for cheaper rates relatively easy. No such thing is available for clean and waste water. Consumers are stuck with the supplier for their region and cannot influence the price they pay.

attributes.action: NHS doctors should not be allowed to charge fees for care home visits
attributes.background: NHS doctors should not be allowed charge extra fees for care home visits.Currently some practices are charging care homes circa £100,00 per year as a retainer.The elderly have, generally, paid into the national health service all of their lives and now in their old age are being penalised.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for children to be unloaded from a vehicle in to the roadway
attributes.background: On my way to work I often see parents unloading their toddlers and children on to the roadway. It would not take much for a child to end up being injured by a passing car. I think children should be unloaded on the kerbside for their own safety.

attributes.action: Make full home inspection surveys mandatory on purchases -'buyer beware' caveat
attributes.background: 4 in 5 home buyers do not bother with full structual surveys.  This can often lead to thousands in repairs and structural work which can put enormous strain on families.  A mandatory home survey system similar to Scotland home report is needed to protect buyers and save families misery of repairs.
attributes.additional_details: Not enough guidance is issued to buyers from banks and/or estate agents about the sheer importance of buying a property without a full survey. A law change is needed to make it mandatory that full structural surveys are conducted prior to purchases either from the buyer or similar to Scotland Home report; from the seller

attributes.action: Pay the unemployed to drive ambulances
attributes.background: just a gud idea
attributes.additional_details: it's a no-brainer

attributes.action: Free Prescription for Head Lice Treatment for under 16's
attributes.background: Most parents treat their childrens hair as soon as they find lice but some parents simply can't afford the treatment. Which means the parents who do buy treatment are constantly treating their children's hair for them to only get them again in a few days.

attributes.action: specially equipped side rooms in hospital for people with disabilities.
attributes.background: I am 24 years old i have a physical condition called muscular dystrophy i have had numerous hospital admissions and found the experience of being on a ward difficult due to having this condition, I have to take a variety of equipment which included shower/toilet chair specalist respiratory equipment
attributes.additional_details: A side room that is available to people with a disability would benefit the person, it would speed up recovery and prevent long term stays. I feel i would make a quicker recovery if all equipment i.e ceiling hoist was available as waiting for hoists is very stressful. privacy and dignity is a huge thing for someone with a disability and having somewhere private is essential, I am arguing the case for people with complex disability and the side room would only be available on a priority basis.

attributes.action: Prevent coffee from being sold to under 16 year olds
attributes.background:
A coffee shop served my 11 year old coffee without any adult being present. Apparently this is a done thing
Energy drinks have an age limit so therefore I feel something so high in caffeine should have the same restrictions.
Serving coffee to people so young without parents should not be allowed

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Ask public about immigration before negotiating new EU deals
attributes.background: On June 23rd the UK voted to leave the EU. A number of public figures have suggested which factors swayed voters, but the question asked makes it impossible to know public opinion on specific issues. We believe the government cannot claim a mandate to negotiate a new deal without polling.
attributes.additional_details: Some have claimed that immigration was a key factor in the result, but it is impossible to say for certain that a majority of those who voted leave did so to prevent free movement of people. The government should take steps to more effectively gauge public opinion on the nature of Britain’s exit from the EU, so that it can act on facts, not speculation. The issues of environmental legislation, the EU arrest warrant, and the court of human rights should also be included in the poll.

attributes.action: To let 13-17 year olds vote.
attributes.background: I think after the European referendum, people have now realisd the real consequence of the outcome but what people don't understand is that it will affect our children's futures. They should have the right to vote to protect their futures and decide what is right.

attributes.action: have a general election and a  referendum on the eu membership
attributes.background: as i don't believe people had the full facts of what they were doing and what would happen as the truth was not told

attributes.action: Allow business owners the option of allowing their customers to smoke indoors.
attributes.background: With people endorsing Brexit, it is abundantly clear that people are fed up with government intervention in their lives. By repealing the in-door smoking ban for businesses, trade would increase, especially in the cold months.

attributes.action: Allow smoke bombs/pyrotechnics at football matches.
attributes.background: It will improve the atmosphere at the games.

attributes.action: A 30 hour working week, also make any extra hours worked payable in overtime.
attributes.background: I work in hospitality, and have realised that the people working in hotels are overworked and very underpaid. But not only in this industry, lorry drivers, security guards shopworkers, every industry.

attributes.action: Block the ability to share government petitions on Facebook.
attributes.background: We are seeing an increase in the number of petitions created and shared on social media. These petitions have become slightly annoying and we this British people urge for these to be distributed by private messaging only.

attributes.action: Trigger Article 50 and then immediately hold a general Election
attributes.background: Votes have been cast, now we demand the government deliver change. No politicians have a mandate to take this forward.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell cot bumper which can cause suffocation to babies.
attributes.background: The safety of cot bumpers is questionable because of the risk of suffocation and/or strangulation. They can also be used to climb on when your baby becomes more mobile so they're not recommended yet they still sold in stores to unaware parents.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2015/11/151124081508.htm

attributes.action: Not allow people over 60 to vote in referendums or other elections.
attributes.background: Many elections including the EU referendum will mainly affect people who are currently working. Only people between 18-60 should be able to vote as the outcome is going to only affect them especially people aged 18-30 as it is there future which could be at stake.
attributes.additional_details: In the recent EU referendum, according to YouGov, 75% of people aged 18-25 voted to remain apart of the EU. It's their future which is going to affected by older people who may not still be around for the outcome of the referendum.

attributes.action: Scotland should hold a second independence referendum within 6 months.
attributes.background: The Scottish people should be given an opportunity to choose between remaining in the EU or the United Kingdom. From England's perspective this issue needs resolving quickly so that negotiations with the EU can proceed without uncertainty over Scotland's position.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's on road,6pm Friday to 6am Monday,June to August,for holiday traffic.
attributes.background: This proposal would considerably ease congestion in the holiday season,and has been shown to work in Sweden.Goods deliveries can be scheduled during the rest of the week with minimal disruption .

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB

attributes.action: Start petition to have Scotland removed from the UK
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon has undemocratically gone against EU referendum .The SNP are threatening to veto Exit of UK from EU.As this is against the wish o the majority it is undemocratic and an outrage against the majority! Scotland itself did not get in entirety for remaining.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of acceptance to exit is dangerous and selfish.The selfishness of the Scottish Parliament is a threat to a proud and strong UK.

attributes.action: Rename the 'House of Lords' to give it a gender neutral title.
attributes.background: The House of Lords immortalises the idea that it is men who rule the country. In order to take a significant step towards an otherwise overlooked deficiency in political equality, we should retitle the House of Lords so as to retain gender neutrality - for instance, to the House of Peers.

attributes.action: let Australian and other Commonwealth countries practice Nursing in the UK
attributes.background: Let countries such as Australia be able to come to the UK and practice Nursing unlike the current law of only letting EU nurses practice with out having to re-training

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over £1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU membership referendum within 18 months.
attributes.background:
(1) Young people could not vote.
(2) Voters based their decision to leave on incomplete information.
(3) Winning margin was too narrow. 

A referendum of this weight should allow 16 - 17 year old people to vote. 

The UK should only exit if leave vote wins by a substantial margin.
attributes.additional_details:
(1) http://goo.gl/krTYyR (Independent)

(2) http://goo.gl/wBfX74 (The Guardian) and https://goo.gl/1Jd1Mp (Washington Post)

(3) http://goo.gl/SXEWTS (Mirror)

To quote the UKIP leadership, the winning margin was too narrow and therefore this is unfinished business by a long way.

The very existence of the United Kingdom as we know it and of the European Union, built over 7 decades, hangs in the balance.

attributes.action: Allow students (12-16 age) to vote in the (second) EU Referendum
attributes.background: It's important for students to vote in the EU referendum  because it affects their life and their future life.They came here or born here for a better life (education+job) and they are more used to EU lifestyle
attributes.additional_details:
The pound rate has already gone down meaning UK will be badly financially affected.UK won't be able to trade in EU countries.Pupil from other European countries won't be able to migrate in UK and make our country proud.Example:Mo Farah,who is a migrant who made Britain PROUD.
Remember a quote from a girl "It's better to be part of something that is bigger than yourself" Would you like to be alone for your whole life or be with someone who will support you?
"Be safe and remain in EU"

attributes.action: Cut down University fees to £6,000
attributes.background: Kids/teenagers in this generation want to do well for the future and to do that they need to go University. But how will they go University if the University fee's are higher than they used to be? What if the fees go higher?
